Dirk - would you happen to have a copy of the workspace you were building ? 

Presumably some badness had occurred to our built state file, and we were 
unable to read it back in during the next session. 

Was this workspace properly shutdown in the previous session ? (i.e. did you 
not exit by killing the VM/ctrl-C ?).

From Dirk:
- was indeed the first build during the session
- was an existing self-hosted workspace which got started on latest RCP build 
for the first time.

Kent:
would the perf change for reading built state would have affected the built 
state reading ?

No the performance change would not cause this. All we did was change some 
arrays to sets to hold info we were reading.

This looks like the build state file was truncated for some reason.

Dirk: Any chance your disk was full?

There is not enough here to go on without the actual file for the build state. 
We have not seen anything like this so far. We will keep it around in case 
something else shows up.

It could have been anything including a disk controller failure or vm problem.

just experienced the same exception on I20031119_latest_of_the_day
- under Linux RH 9.0 (-> ajusted OS)
- workspace has worked before with the same build, and it was not the first
build / startup
- shutdown had been semi-normal, I remember an IllegalStateException thrown from
JobManager.
Did you keep the build state files?
sorry, no - not much help I guess.
